result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy J. Jimmerson

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Case Called: 1:33 p.m.
Clerk: Nicole.

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig. Defendant appears in person with Atty Paige Metzman.

Waiver of Prelim filed.
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

COURT finds probable cause. Defendant bound over for arraignment and trial.
Information to be e-filed. R/W; R/J.

PLEA>> NOT GUILTY.

DATES:
PTC: 11/17/22 @ 11:00 a.m. (Defendant is excused, must be available by phone)

Bond continues.

Adjourned: 1:35 p.m.
Intake Report- Marathon County Pretrial Services  - Completed 10-25-2022
State appears by ADA Puig. Atty Metzman appears on behalf of deft. Dates remain on as set.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:05 p.m.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.

Advised Right of Counsel.

- No possession or use of firearms. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
